Utterance: Hi there! It’s nice to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi! I’ve been okay. I tried waking up earlier like we talked about.
That’s great to hear! How did that go for you?
It was tough at first, but I think it helped a bit. I felt less rushed in the mornings.
That’s a fantastic outcome! What changes did you notice throughout your day?
I was less stressed, and I had time to eat breakfast, which made a difference.
I’m glad to hear that! Having a good breakfast can really set a positive tone. Have you been able to maintain that routine?
Mostly, but I still struggle on days when I have to work early.
That’s understandable. It’s important to be flexible with your routine. Maybe you can adjust your wake-up time slightly on those days?
Yeah, I could do that. I’ll have to plan better.
Planning ahead can definitely help. Now, how about football? Have you been able to play or practice since we last spoke?
Yes! I played a few times with some friends. It felt really good.
That’s wonderful! How did it impact your mood?
It made me feel happier and more energized.
That’s fantastic! Engaging in activities you love can be a great mood booster. Are there any other activities you’d like to explore that might bring you joy?
I’d like to try joining a local league or something. Just to get back into it.
That sounds like a great idea! Being part of a team can also provide social support. Have you looked into any local leagues yet?
Not yet, but I’ll check it out.
Excellent! Let’s keep that as a goal for the upcoming weeks. Now, how have things been with your son? Any new developments?
He’s been doing well! We’ve been spending more time together, especially with homework.
That’s wonderful to hear! How has that experience been for you both?
It’s been good. I feel more connected with him, and he seems to appreciate the help.
That connection is so important. Have you noticed any changes in his attitude or behavior since you’ve been more involved?
Yeah, he seems more confident. He’s been excited to show me his work.
That’s a great sign! Encouragement and involvement can really foster that confidence. Now, let’s talk about sleep again. How has your sleep been since we last spoke?
I’ve been trying the bedtime routine, but I still have some rough nights.
It’s a process, and it’s okay to have ups and downs. What elements of the routine have been working for you?
The stretching helps a bit, but I still have trouble shutting my mind off.
That’s a common challenge. Have you considered mindfulness or meditation techniques to help clear your mind before bed?
I’ve heard about it, but I haven’t tried it yet.
Mindfulness can be really beneficial. Would you like to try a simple breathing exercise together now?
Sure, I’d like that.
Great! Let’s take a deep breath in through your nose… and out through your mouth. Focus on the breath. In… and out.
*breathes*
As you breathe, let go of any tension in your body. Just focus on this moment.
That feels nice.
I’m glad! Practicing this for a few minutes each night could help ease your mind. Would you be willing to try that?
Yes, I’ll give it a shot.
Wonderful! It’s all about finding what works for you. Is there anything else you’d like to explore today?
I think that’s it for now.
Alright! I’m looking forward to hearing how your week goes. Remember to be kind to yourself as you work through these changes. Take care!
Thank you! See you next time.
